[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The National Library of Medicine (NLM) Digital Repository defines requirements for preserving biomedical content using digital infrastructure.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: NLM Digital Repository integrates with NLM services like PubMed Central and Bookshelf.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: NLM Digital Repository provides web dashboards and mobile-friendly interfaces.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: NLM Digital Repository supports APIs for content management and retrieval.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: NLM Digital Repository uses TLS 1.3 and HTTPS for secure data transmission.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: NLM Digital Repository optimizes memory usage for high-performance caching.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: NLM Digital Repository ensures 24/7 availability with automated backups.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: NLM Digital Repository is configurable for multi-region deployment.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: NLM Digital Repository connects to analytics and citation databases.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 MISSING-TAG2: NLM Digital Repository runs on cloud-based servers for scalability.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: NLM Digital Repository supports ingest, metadata management, storage, and retrieval.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: NLM Digital Repository is designed for researchers, librarians, and technical staff.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: NLM Digital Repository relies on secure networks and industry-compliant infrastructure.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: NLM Digital Repository assumes compatibility with archival standards and cloud services.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Metadata: Structured information describing digital content.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 MISSING-TAG1: NLM Digital Repository enables efficient management, access, and long-term storage of biomedical materials.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with metadata harvesting protocols like OAI-PMH.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall use HTTPS for secure transfer.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall provide workflows for content ingestion and validation (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall validate metadata upon ingestion (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a user-friendly web interface for content management.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall comply with WCAG 2.1 accessibility standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall support 10,000 concurrent requests.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall return queries in under 2 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store metadata for all digital assets.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall implement role-based access control.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall use modular architecture.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall encrypt data using TLS 1.3.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with ISO 27001, WCAG 2.1 guidelines and follow OAIS and Dublin Core metadata standards.
[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-002: The system shall implement PREMIS metadata schema.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall support scalable storage architecture.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall enforce multi-factor authentication for secure access.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Metadata validation, integration testing, and quality assurance assessments.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API docs, and configurations.
[SEC] 5. References: OAIS, Dublin Core, METS, and PREMIS.
